feed.title: LF-Air
feed.subtitle: RSS feed based on RSS and LLM.

entry.title: Vite report on Sun, 20 Aug 2023 06:00:54
entry.summary:
Tech:
- Oil companies are using influencers and PR firms to target younger generations on social media.
- Apple devices are being spoofed, Elon Musk taunts Mark Zuckerberg, and Better.com goes public.
- A comprehensive RDF dataset with over 26 billion triples covering scholarly data across all scientific disciplines has been introduced by an AI paper.
- Meta's news ban is preventing Canadians from sharing important information about wildfires in western Canada.
- Spotify considered banning white noise podcasts to increase profitability.

Business:
- A judge dismissed a defamation suit against a newspaper, potentially leading to the closure of the paper due to legal fees.
- A nearly $200,000 fine threatens to shut down a Florida abortion clinic, but activists have already crowdfunded half of it.
- Kroger is using sushi as a secret weapon to attract customers and compete in the dining-out industry.

AI:
- People prefer human art over AI art, but the preference is complex.

Other:
- Stormzy's performance at All Points East received mixed reviews, with a slow start but an exciting finish.
- Ukraine is targeting Moscow with drone strikes, causing airport closures.
- North Korea's new ICBM closely resembles a Russian ICBM, according to experts.
- The Little Rock Nine members criticize restrictions on an AP African American Studies course in Arkansas.
- Hurricane Hilary poses significant risks to the western US, with three important messages to be aware of.
- A 1954 Ferrari shell was sold for nearly $2 million.
- 70 years ago, an Anglo-US coup led to decades of oppression in Iran.
- July 4th is not the US's birthday, and there is a story about how Ben Franklin played a role in the creation of the US.
- The Air Force is funding the development of a 'blended wing body' design for fuel-efficient flight.
- Helidon NÃ­ma is the first Java microservices framework based on virtual threads.

Insights:
- Oil companies are adapting their marketing strategies to target younger demographics through social media influencers.
- The use of AI in scholarly research is expanding, with a comprehensive RDF dataset being introduced.
- The preference for human art over AI art highlights the complexity of human perception and appreciation.
- The impact of Meta's news ban on sharing vital information during emergencies is concerning.
- The battle for profitability in the streaming industry has led Spotify to consider banning certain types of podcasts.
- Legal battles and fines pose threats to media outlets and abortion clinics, but public support and crowdfunding efforts can provide relief.
- Kroger's innovative approach to attract customers through sushi demonstrates the competitive nature of the dining-out industry.
- Historical events, such as the Anglo-US coup in Iran, continue to have long-lasting effects on nations and their people.
- Natural disasters, like Hurricane Hilary, require effective communication and preparedness in affected regions.
- The value of collectible items, such as the rusted shell of a 1954 Ferrari, can reach significant prices in the market.
